title.narrative: HJPC Judicial and prosecutorial efficiency Phase 2
HJPC Judicial and prosecutorial efficiency Phase 2

description.narrative: Improving Court Efficiency and Accountability of Judges and Prosecutors in BiH Phase 2

Projektet är en fortsättning på förbättrad effektivisering inom HJPC. Resultaten i den andra fasen är att förbättra effektiviteten i domstolar. Effekten av stödet är att ha ett domstolsystem som garanterar människor rättigheten till rättvisa rättegångar inom rimlig tid. Detta är en förutsättning för anslutning till EU-medlemskap. Effekterna av projektet kommer också bidra till att allmänhetens uppfattning av domstolsystem förbättras och också leda till en mer funktionell ekonomi.

There are several overall intended outcomes contributing the overall impact of improving the efficiency of judiciary in Bosnia Herzegovina in the programme. They are as follows:-Improving court case management-Improving internal reorganization of courts and human resources at courts - Improving enforcement proceedings in judiciary-Improving gender equality, vulnerable groups and cooperation with NGOs- Reinforcing the Independence and Accountability of the Judiciary Indicators have been developed for the following main outputs Improved internal reorganization of courts to enable faster and better processing of tasks and work processes in courts in cooperation with SNCA Improved archive management at courts with the implementation the archive management and CMS records digitalisation process Increased number of processed cases, reduced lenght of proceedings and improved quality of proceedings in bankruptcy and liquidation casesImproved enforcement against movables, use of more efficient assets and means of enforcement and increased availability and visibility of information regarding public sale hearings Increased number of processed cases and reduced lenght of proceedings and influx of civi cases (against budget users) Increased number of processed, reduced the lenght of proceedings and improved quality of conducted of proceedings in bankruptcy and liquidation cases Improved promotion of court settlement and mediationPublic debate to identify the optimal system solution model for enforcement procedures is establishedImproved enforcement procedures by promoting and applying the Personal Data Protection Agency Opinion in order to obtain data on the property of a debtor Established and developed cooperation with the NGOs Improved work processes in enforcement departments and strengthened the role of court bailiffs and their training Established electronic system for submission, recording, processing and monitoring of judges and prosecutors’ financial statements - the SuRePro Monitor

tag.narrative: 16.3 - Främja rättssäkerheten på nationell och internationell nivå samt säkerställa lika tillgång till rättvisa för alla.
16.3 - Promote the rule of law at the national and international levels and ensure equal access to justice for all.

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: The final narrative and financial reporting has been received with a slight delay. All reporting is complete including final audits which after it is approved will result in a repayment of 44 181 EUR approx. from HJPC and 19 000 SEK from SNCA.The project reporting follows RBM principles. There is a summary LFA and a narrative explanation of underperformance in certain indicators for the whole programme. The point is made that consideration should be given for the period 2016-2019 because in the first half of 2020, the courts operated in significantly reduced capacities due to the COVID19 pandemic. 1. Case management at courts None of the targets (against baseline) have been achieved fully. Still the overall progress is not lacking, as the setting of targets was too ambitious and not based on a thorough enough analysis of complex problems which to be solved require the reform actions of multiple stakeholders (not only courts) including legislative amendments and reform of administrative authorities. Taking one important indicator, it is the influx of administrative cases. The target was a decrease of 33%. In reality what was achieved was a decrease of 15%. Another not so well performing indicator has been on the length of bankruptcy cases.The length decreased by only 9% of the target. The length of liquidation cases did decrease and reached almost 90% of the target against baseline. Archive management was improved at all planned courts. 2. Internal reorganization of courts This component has exceeded targets of number of implemented recommendations.This component was implemented in partnership with SNCA and has been very successful. 3 Enforcement procedure reform This component also showed very good results against plan. The number of workshops exceeded plans and the number of cases in alternative case enforcement was more than twice exceeded against plan. This was due to also to a positive Opinion from the Agency for Personal Data Protection which the project helped to promote. 4. Gender equality, vulnerable groups and cooperation with NGOs In this component, all targets were twice exceeded. 5. Project documentation developed for construction/reconstruction of judicial buildings(with IPA support, this activity was added to the programme through a cost addition/amendment) In this component all work was finalized according to plans. 6. Established electronic system for filing and tracking of financial statements This component did not perform to plan. Although a software has been developed, the Agency for Personal Data Protection stopped its implementation. The reason is complex, and requires progress of the highly politicized HJPC Law reform. It is assessed to be partially beyond HJPC direct control.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
